info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN GUERNSEY...NORTHWESTERN MONROE...SOUTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM...SOUTHWESTERN BELMONT AND NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McConnelsville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Caldwell, Byesville, Dudley, Quaker City, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Cumberland, Lore City, Old Washington, Summerfield, and Belle Valley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 177 and 187. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 19 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio.
